TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content: wHEN EVERYTHING YOU TYpe starts out in all caps.

wHEN EVERYTHING YOU TYpe starts out in all caps.

No matter how mant times I do it, I never learn.
Like my other hobbies i usually know it's time to stop when i start seeing double.
When you throw a frog and yell "Fly Jebediah, fly!"
When you pull the car up in the drive and try to hit space to jettison your door...
When you realize you have a dry throat after building stuff for 4 hours straight staring at the screen with your mouth open with a drink only 1/2 a foot away.

When you realize you have a dry throat after building stuff for 4 hours straight staring at the screen with your mouth open with a drink only 1/2 a foot away.

I can't even count how many cups of cold coffee I've tossed out from this phenomenon... and yet I still didn't fall asleep from lack of caffeine!?!

I can't even count how many cups of cold coffee I've tossed out from this phenomenon... and yet I still didn't fall asleep from lack of caffeine!?!

That's why I bought a giant thermal mug. Sometimes coffee still gets cold though.

.. oeff.. just dropped out of KSP.. bugs in the VAB!

ehm, what date is it?
When you star accusing yourself of faking your own Mun landings....

You know you play too much KSP when your next mission is a space station around Gilly.

(Definitely not mine; just made it up. I haven't even docked around Kerbin yet.)
When you keep mistaking Mars for Duna.
When you see the first star in the sky, and you think it's Minmus.
When you assume any flying thing in the air is debris or Jebediah.
Seeing that full moon the other night made me want to go there. I almost felt I could.
When you start tossing and turning in bed because your mind is filled with the thought of building an awesome space station.
You know you play too much KSP, when you think you are really a rocket scientist..

Walking:

"Whew. I'm sweating a lot. I should take off my clothes. Might help my Delta-V".

When trying to recall the planets to the solar system you think Moho, Eve, Kerbin- god damn it, I mean mercury...

I swear my daughter will grow up knowing KSP planets before the actuall planets.
When the first thing you do after getting into your car is "activate ASAS"
When you start going through withdrawal problems when you stop playing KSP for a while

I was watching Star Wars, and agonizing over the fact that it was all wrong.

"why are they using that cockpit, it's much to heavy."

I stopped caring about these facts long before i got my hands on orbiter. Now i know that all science fiction movies (except for the ultra hardcore ones) are pure wrong in terms of Orbital mechanics and space in general, but I am still entertained by them, even though they get it all wrong (not because its all wrong, thats a difference^^). I made my peace with this. Now i can truly enjoy every kind of Sci-Fi, not only hard, but also soft SF and SF that has the density of gelee (being neither really hard nor soft^^)

Anyway... you know you play to much ksp when you actually start thinking that everything alse in existence has only one purpose. To hinder you playing KSP!

CURSE YOU EXISTENCE!
May have already been said, but when you start planning maneuver nodes to go grocery shopping.

When you catch yourself walking, YES WALKING like a kerbal...

When you wonder how much DeltaV you have expended...

When you laugh at your friends for not knowing what prograde means....

You hum the VAB tune...

When you read about accidents and tragedies in the history of real-life spaceflight, and just for a moment, you struggle to understand that a space agency could actually be accountable for the amount of money it spent or deaths it caused. Don't they just go back to the VAB screen?
